Description: Ensures a class has only one instance and provides global access
Example: class Singleton { static instance; constructor() { if (Singleton.instance) return Singleton.instance; } }

Description: Creates objects without specifying exact class
Example: function createUser(type) { if (type === 'admin') return new Admin(); return new User(); }

Description: Objects notify observers about state changes
Example: class Subject { observers = []; notify() { observers.forEach(o => o.update()); } }

Description: Mediates between domain and data mapping layers
Separates application into Model View Controller
Example: Model: data logic; View: UI; Controller: business logic
S: Single Responsibility; O: Open/Closed; L: Liskov Substitution; I: Interface Segregation; D: Dependency Inversion

Description: Injects dependencies instead of creating them

Example: function Button({ label, onClick }) { return <button onClick={onClick}>{label}</button>; }

Description: Reusable stateful logic in functional components
Example: function useCounter(initial) { const [count, setCount] = useState(initial); return [count, () => setCount(count + 1)]; }

Description: Encapsulates business logic separate from controllers
Example: class OrderService { async createOrder(data) { /* business logic */ } }

Description: Catches JavaScript errors in component tree
Example: class ErrorBoundary extends React.Component { componentDidCatch(error) { this.setState({ error }); } }

Description: Caches function results for same inputs
Example: const memoized = useMemo(() => expensiveCalculation(a, b), [a, b]);

Keywords: lazy loading code splitting dynamic import
